title: 103_s1998
content: Acquisition of Roosevelt family lands. The Secretary of the Interior may acquire lands and interests in lands at Hyde Park, New York, owned by Franklin D. Roosevelt or his family at the time of his death. The Secretary of the Interior can only acquire residential properties on the lands depicted on the map referred to in subsection (a) that were owned or occupied by Franklin D. Roosevelt or his family, including his parents, siblings, wife, and children, at the Roosevelt Family Estate in November 1993. The Secretary of the Interior can acquire lands and interests in lands owned by the State of New York or its political subdivisions through donation. Priority is given to acquiring tracts of lands pursuant to this section. The Secretary may pay for costs associated with acquiring land and interests in land, which will be added to and administered as part of the acquired lands. Authorization of appropriations is granted for necessary funds to carry out this Act, including adding and administering the acquired lands at the designated historic sites. The Act authorizes the acquisition of lands for designated historic sites. The Secretary of the Interior is authorized to acquire lands in Hyde Park, New York for protection, including the "Open Park Hodhome Tract", "Top Cottage Tract", and "Poughkeepsie Shopping Center, Inc. Tract". The acquired lands will be administered as part of the Franklin Delano Roosevelt National. Authorization of up to $3,000,000 is approved for the Secretary to acquire lands in Hyde Park, New York for the Franklin Delano Roosevelt National Historic Site or the Eleanor Roosevelt National Historic Site.
